Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2009 07:56PM revricki wrote: Hi ladies. I'm on TCx4 and today is day 19 post my first treatment. Out of the blue I had a lot of nausea today. So unexpected considering I haven't had more than a minute of it here and there. I have Zofran, Compazine and Ativan on hand. I have been using Ativan to help me sleep. Today I tried Zofran for the nausea and it barely helped. Has anyone tried Compazine? Does it work? Does it make you sleepy? Thanks for any advise. I don't know what I would do without this website.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 07:28PM revricki wrote: I had my 2nd round of TC today. So far just a bit tired and heartburn, not bad. BUT I am so bloated!!! I look 5 months pregnant! I had mild bloating with TX #1 but it was barely noticeable and went away in a few days. I'm a little concerned because I'm starting out so big on day one. Anyone????
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2009 07:47AM revricki wrote: Hi everyone. Today is day 7 of TX#2 of 4 TC. This round has been different. The good news is that the Claritin DID help with the bone pain that kept me in bed for 3 days after TX#1. I still had bone pain but it was manageable and did not keep me in bed. The bloating was worse and so was the fatigue and weakness. One new symptom this time is dizziness. My onc had me come in today for 2 hrs of hydration. My BP is very low and my pulse is very high (racing heart). They said high pulse is my body/heart working overtime to compensate for low BP. They want me back in tmrw for more hydration and think that the low BP/high pulse is dehydration. Feeling depressed now and having a hard time seeing the light at the end of the tunnel, even though I know it's there....it better be after all this S&%T!! Boy, this stinks!! Sorry for venting....party of one.... Has anyone experienced low BP/high heart rate??
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 12:37AM revricki wrote: Just adding my two cents on the eyebrow discussion. I had four rounds of TC and after each round my brows thinned more and more. 3 weeks after the last treatment they were down to a single line of hair and I HATED it. It changed my whole face and I looked sick. Luckily my wig has bangs so they did a good job of covering up. Nothing grew in for 4 weeks then...five o'clock shadow, then stubble and 2 weeks later I had to have them waxed and shaped. Now they look like I never lost them.  The eyelashes went too in the same pattern although when they fell the new short ones were right behind so I never looked like I didn't have lashes. Before mine fell they got VERY long, it seems because they were being pushed out. The eyelash situation did not bother me at all. Some woman on this forum have said that they fall out again at 4/5 months but I have read many posts were woman did not experience loss a second time...so we shall see.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2009 12:58PM revricki wrote: Hello hair thread ladies! Two weeks after tx#1 about 70% of my hair fell out so I shaved it all off razor smooth a week later. I guess the 30% continued growing and is now maybe 1/8 of an inch and looks AWFUL. Next week is my last chemo (t/c). Thank god!!!!! QUESTION - Should I shave it smooth again after last chemo so that it all grows back evenly or leave it alone and let the new hairs catch up??
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2009 07:43PM revricki wrote: Yesterday I had my hair shaved off and it felt great. I feel as if I took a big step forward in this slooow process. I wore the wig all day yesterday and then took it off before my kids went to sleep and let them touch my head. I thought it would scare them to see me without hair but it didn't at all. Kids can handle some things better than most adults. I slept better last night b/c the anxiety of losing my hair was gone! Today I skipped the wig and wore a halo with a bandana..very cute look.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2009 12:03PM revricki wrote: Help with my wig please.  Hi all. Thank you posting pics, they are so great and encouraging to see. I'm having a problem with my wig and hope someone can help me. I had my hair buzzed off and what's left looks like a five o'clock shadow. I had a custom human hair wig made that looks amazing (hard to tell its not a wig) The wig stays on with five adhesive strips (3 along my hair line and 2 along the back of my neck. Problem is that every time I take it off the adhesive strips pull out more and more of my five oclock shadow stubble and OUCH! The wigmaker said that eventually all those hairs will be gone and my scalp will be completely bald and smooth so the tape will not hurt BUT what about when my hair starts to grow back?? I don't want the tape to pull out whatever new hair is trying to com back. Is it true that all the stubble will fall out too??  Has anyone experienced something like this before??  Thanks for any input.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2009 01:37AM revricki wrote: Chelev, you seem to know so much about eyebrow/eyelash loss! I'm half way thru 4 rounds of TC and today noticed two tiny patches (one in each brow) of missing hair. I read somewhere on the boards about stencils. Did you use them? What I don't get is...if I use pencils/powders to fill in my brows, then what happens when I wipe it off at night with make up remover? Won't the wiping pull out more loose hairs that would otherwise not fall out?? Seems like a catch 22.

Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2010 02:23AM revricki wrote: Hi everyone! Update - I am 14 weeks post FN chemo and I ditched the wig last week!! I did not expect to do it so soon but I simply could not take another moment of hats, scarves and my wig. Surprisingly people love it. I get so many compliments on my hair... it's crazy....and from strangers! It looks like an intentionally VERY short pixie. Felt so great to put away the wig...in the back of a drawer. Today I bought a few pairs of new earrings, necklaces and scarves to accessorize and make my look more feminine. I'm actually looking forward to the different stages and styles that my hair will grow into. For all of you waiting for the hair growth, it will come back and it will surprise you how fast it grows. Each week I notice a difference. I will post pics. Feel good everyone!

Posts.Content: revricki wrote: I am 11 weeks out of chemo and 5 weeks out of rads. My 10 1/2 yr old daughter seemed to be handling my diagnosis, surgery, treatment etc really well. However in the last 2 weeks she is having separation anxiety in the mornings before school and when her dad picks her up (I'm divorced). Maybe she is finally letting it all out now that she sees I am fine and practically back to normal. Other than putting her in therapy which I am not a proponent of at this point, any advise on how to help her? Log in to post a reply
